issue.title: [BUG] Ambiguous test outcome and status for serial mode

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
<!-- âš ï¸âš ï¸ Do not delete this template âš ï¸âš ï¸ -->

<!-- ðŸ”Ž Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- ðŸ§ª Test using the latest Playwright release to see if your issue has already been fixed -->
<!-- ðŸ’¡ Provide enough information for us to be able to reproduce your issue locally -->

### System info
- Playwright Version: `v1.39.0`, `v1.40.0`
- Operating System: All
- Browser: n/a
- Other info:

### Source code

- [x] I provided exact source code that allows reproducing the issue locally.

<!-- For simple cases, please provide a self-contained test file along with the config file -->
<!-- For larger cases, you can provide a GitHub repo you created for this issue -->
<!-- If we can not reproduce the problem locally, we won't be able to act on it -->
<!-- You can still file without the exact code and we will try to help, but if we can't repro, it will be closed -->

**Link to the GitHub repository with the repro**

https://github.com/currents-dev/pw-issue-2023-11-23-001

**Steps**

- Checkout  the demo repo, follow README instructions
- Run the test for `1.39`
- Run the test for `1.40`


**Expected**

The following test suite:

```ts
import { expect, test } from "@playwright/test";

test.describe.configure({ mode: "serial", retries: 1 });

test("A", async ({ page }, { retry }) => {
  if (retry === 0) {
    throw new Error("oh!");
  }
  if (retry === 1) {
    expect(true).toBe(true);
  }

});

test("B", async ({ page }, { retry }) => {
  throw new Error("oh!");
});
```

Is supposed to produce the following outcome:
- Test A results status: failed, passed
- Test B results status: skipped, failed

- `onTestBegin` should be invoked for every attempt of every test in a serial group as in `1.39`
- all tests should exhaust all attempts in a serial group

**Actual**

`1.40` runs serial tests group differently and produces different results:
- Test A results status: failed, passed
- Test B results status: failed


- `1.40` doesn't invoke `onTestBegin` for test `B` when `A` fails
- `1.40` doesn't retry test `B` and "swallows" the last retry

issue.title: New API `/snapshots/cancel` is missing from `command-api.yaml`

repository.name: rancher-desktop
repository.description: Container Management and Kubernetes on the Desktop

issue.body:
The API has been added in #6128, but not added to `command-api.yaml`. This breaks `rdctl.e2e.spec.ts`.

It is not clear why this failure is marked as "flakey" in the [E2E tests](https://github.com/rancher-sandbox/rancher-desktop/actions/runs/7120198615/job/19386945657) of #6128; it should fail every time. So maybe there is also something wrong in the way failures are marked as flakey?

This is now holding up the merging of #6120. The fix should be simply to add the API to `command-api.yaml`.

body: hmm same, so bump, any news? After bump to 1.40.1 seems like it's the same case

In our company we also has been affected by this (potentially related to latest serial mode switch).

Unless missing something, it seems like https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/pull/26385 was targeted towards fixing https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/17652#issuecomment-1260552486 which seem to have introduced current edge case regression with serial mode.

On the other hand I read that [serial mode usage is not recommended(for a different reason though)](https://playwright.dev/docs/test-parallel#serial-mode).

I would rather expect that all tests that are not specifically marked as skipped(`test.skip`) to pass at least once before being marked as `Flaky`.

(I see current ticket is marked as feature, but potentially might-be regression)

@aslushnikov @dgozman - can you please confirm if this is expected behavior of how playwright tests suppose to run?

We have a similar issue. When retry is set to > 0 its marking the test a flaky and not a failure. Even though it failed on the retry:
![CleanShot 2024-03-07 at 07 19 54@2x](https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/assets/59891581/aadf7c03-4114-4be2-bc82-51caf0ad4187)
@mxschmitt  is this considered to be a bug?  Has there been any prioritization for it?

issue.title: [Bug]: False positive pipeline when using retries in serial mode

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
### Version

1.42.1

### Steps to reproduce

Repo here: https://github.com/BeeMargarida/playwright-serial-retries-bug

You can see the issue in the [pipeline](https://github.com/BeeMargarida/playwright-serial-retries-bug/actions/runs/8266118282/job/22613372136), in the `Run Playwright tests` step.

Basically, the issue happens in serial mode, where if different tests fail on retries, it will skip not run certain tests and mark the run as successful. 

Simple example of 4 tests and 1 retry:

**first run:**
passes
fails
skips
skips

**1st retry:**
fails
skips
skips
skips

The run ends with 2 flaky tests, 2 skipped tests and marked as successful. This is not successful, it's a false positive since it didn't run all tests.

### Expected behavior

The pipeline fails if it doesn't run all tests in a retry, in serial mode.

### Actual behavior

The pipeline shows as successful even though some tests were not executed.

### Additional context

I'm open to contributing a solution for this, just want feedback on this bug first.

I know serial mode is not recommended, but the use case for this really requires serial mode since it's an offline first PWA that does a big setup on first launch, so it's not useful to launch a new isolated context for each test.

### Environment

```shell
System:
  OS: Linux 6.7 EndeavourOS
  CPU: (16) x64 AMD Ryzen 7 5800X 8-Core Processor
  Memory: 15.79 GB / 31.27 GB
  Container: Yes
Binaries:
  Node: 18.19.0 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.19.0/bin/node
  Yarn: 1.22.21 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.19.0/bin/yarn
  npm: 10.2.3 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.19.0/bin/npm
IDEs:
  VSCode: 1.87.2 - /usr/bin/code
Languages:
  Bash: 5.2.26 - /usr/bin/bash
npmPackages:
  @playwright/test: 1.42.1 => 1.42.1
```

issue.title: fix(playwright): test unexpected result if failed and skipped

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
Fixes #28322

**Changes**:
A test result should be unexpected if it fails (and is not expected) and skips the rest of the runs.
This MR implements this logic, so that runs in serial mode in specific cases (see added unit test) don't cause false positives.

issue.title: fix(reporters): properly determine flaky status for serial mode
